intro.p: The Proportion Test states whether occurrences of category in a distribution has a different proportion than expected from the null hypothesis H0. The node calculates the sample proportion of the category p̂. With the given null-hypothesized proportion p0, a z-Score is calculated via (p̂ - p0)/se, where se is the standard error. If the corresponding p-Value is below the given significance level α, the null hypothesis can be rejected. Missing values will be ignored. See Wikipedia on test statistic, "One-proportion z-test" for further information.

tab.name: Options
tab.option: The distribution column, of type String. Its total number of occurrences without missing values is nobs.
The category to test for. The number of occurrences of this category in the category column is count.

The alternative hypothesis HA: whether the actual proportion p̂=nobs/count is
larger than (GREATER_THAN)
less than (LESS_THAN)
different than (TWO_SIDED)
the null hypothesized distribution p0.
H0 is rejected, if p-Value < α

tab.name: Advanced Settings
tab.option: Whether to calculate the standard error from the sample proportion p̂ rather than the default null hypothesis proportion.

ports.inPort: The table from which to test samples
